title: Youth Entrepreneur Empowerment Program — Village India Platform

requirements.text: Build a backend data model and API for entrepreneur registration, storing: full name, age, gender, village name, panchayat name, district, state, contact info, business idea/category (agriculture, food, environment, sustainability, other), skills, and a short bio. Support create, read, update, and list operations.

quotes: find young enterperuners through each and every willage in india

acceptanceCriteria: An entrepreneur can be registered with all required fields
Entrepreneurs can be listed and filtered by village, panchayat, district, state, and category
Each entrepreneur has a unique ID and profile retrievable by ID
Total entrepreneur count per village/panchayat is queryable

requirements.text: Build a backend data model for success stories and motivational content, allowing admins to post entries with a title, content body, author/entrepreneur name, village, category tag, and date. Support create and list operations.
acceptanceCriteria: Success stories can be created with all required fields
Stories can be listed sorted by date descending
Stories can be filtered by category and village

requirements.text: Build a backend data model for training resources and guides, storing: title, description, resource type (course, guide, tool, video), category (agriculture, food, environment, sustainability, general), and a URL or content body. Support create and list operations.
acceptanceCriteria: Resources can be created and listed
Resources can be filtered by type and category

requirements.text: Build a backend data model for a community connection/networking board, where entrepreneurs can post messages, questions, or collaboration requests tagged with their village, panchayat, category, and a timestamp. Support create and list operations.

quotes: connact them to be a enterperuer

acceptanceCriteria: Community posts can be created and listed
Posts can be filtered by village, panchayat, and category
Each post shows author name, village, and timestamp

requirements.text: Create a Home/Landing page that introduces the Youth Entrepreneur Empowerment Program mission — discovering, equipping, motivating, and connecting young entrepreneurs across every village and panchayat in India — with a clear call to action to register as an entrepreneur or explore the platform.

quotes: empower them and eqipe them and motivate them and connact them
change the face oof nation and feed the world and prtact the enrvimnet

acceptanceCriteria: Landing page displays the program mission and vision clearly in English
A prominent 'Register as Entrepreneur' button is visible
Navigation links to all major sections (Register, Community, Resources, Stories, Dashboard) are present
Page renders the generated hero banner image as the main visual

requirements.text: Create an Entrepreneur Registration page with a multi-field form (name, age, gender, village, panchayat, district, state, category of business idea, skills, bio, contact). On submission, call the backend to save the record and show a success confirmation.

quotes: find young enterperuners through each and every willage in india

acceptanceCriteria: All required fields are validated before submission
Dropdown options are provided for category and state
Successful registration shows a confirmation message
Form is mobile-responsive

requirements.text: Create an Entrepreneur Directory/Browse page that lists registered entrepreneurs with their name, village, panchayat, and business category. Include filters for state, district, panchayat, and category. Clicking an entrepreneur opens their full profile.
acceptanceCriteria: Directory shows a paginated or scrollable list of entrepreneurs
Filter controls work and update the list in real time
Entrepreneur profile page shows all stored fields
Empty state is displayed when no results match filters

requirements.text: Create a Village/Panchayat Dashboard page that displays each panchayat with its registered entrepreneur count and a visual progress indicator toward the 100–1000 target. Show category breakdowns (agriculture, food, environment, sustainability) per panchayat.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard lists panchayats with their entrepreneur counts
A progress bar or indicator shows progress toward 1000 entrepreneurs
Category breakdown is visible per panchayat
Dashboard updates based on live backend data

requirements.text: Create a Training & Resources page listing available guides, courses, and tools filtered by category (agriculture/food security, environment/sustainability, general entrepreneurship). Each resource card shows title, type, description, and a link or read-more action.

quotes: feed the world and prtact the enrvimnet

acceptanceCriteria: Resources are listed with filter tabs for category and type
Each card displays all required fields
Clicking a resource opens its content or external URL

requirements.text: Create a Motivation Hub page displaying success stories of entrepreneurs from across Indian villages, with author name, village, category, story content, and date. Include an inspiring headline section at the top.
acceptanceCriteria: Success stories are listed sorted by most recent
Category and village filter options are available
Each story card shows author, village, category, excerpt, and date
Full story is viewable on click

requirements.text: Create a Community Connect page where entrepreneurs can post messages, questions, or collaboration requests. Display the community board with posts showing author name, village, category, timestamp, and message. Include a post submission form.

quotes: connact them to be a enterperuer in each pachaythu

acceptanceCriteria: Community board displays posts in reverse-chronological order
Post submission form requires name, village, category, and message
Posts can be filtered by category and panchayat
New posts appear immediately after submission

requirements.text: Apply a vibrant, earthy, and energetic visual theme across the entire frontend — inspired by rural India with modern ambition. Use warm saffron, deep green, and off-white as the primary palette with bold typography. The design should feel empowering, grassroots, and optimistic, consistently applied across all pages and components.

quotes: change the face oof nation and feed the world and prtact the enrvimnet

acceptanceCriteria: Saffron, deep green, and off-white color scheme is used consistently site-wide
Typography is bold and readable across all screen sizes
All pages share a consistent header, footer, and navigation style
Theme evokes rural empowerment and national pride without being clichéd

requirements.text: Render the generated hero banner image (hero-banner.dim_1440x600.png) on the landing page as the main visual, and the village mosaic image (village-mosaic.dim_800x400.png) on the Dashboard page to reinforce the rural India context. Store both in frontend/public/assets/generated.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero banner is displayed prominently at the top of the landing page
Village mosaic image is displayed on the Dashboard page
Images load correctly from frontend/public/assets/generated
Images are responsive and do not break layout on mobile

constraints: All backend logic must remain in a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo
Do not use any external databases or cloud services
Do not modify any files listed in frontend.immutablePaths
Use English for all user-facing text
nonGoals: Internet Identity or user authentication in this initial build
Integration with government or external APIs

required: Wide panoramic hero banner: vibrant rural Indian village landscape at sunrise with young people working, farming, and collaborating, saffron and green color tones, warm and uplifting mood (hero-banner.dim_1440x600.png)
Mosaic collage of colorful Indian village scenes: fields, markets, small workshops, community gatherings, warm earthy tones (village-mosaic.dim_800x400.png)
Bold circular emblem logo with a rising sun over a green field and silhouette of a young entrepreneur, saffron and green palette (program-logo.dim_256x256.png)
